I'm a blackbox  tester and I put my tests outside the package tree. This
is because my tests are based on business rules, not defined by the
class methods. I had about 20 classes of tests testing only 1
development class.
But I think if you were a programmer, doing unit testing, you would keep
them together.
Just a thought.
Pam.

-----Original Message-----
From: mark_lybarger [mailto:mark_lybarger@...] 
Sent: Saturday, December 11, 2004 1:23 AM
To: junit@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [junit] junit test class location - with or without source
code.




i'm looking for arguments for and against keeping junit test classes
outside if the projects main source tree.  maybe this could be a pole,
but i'm after the arguments more than what everyone actually is doing.

thanks.
